def _get_grouper(
    obj,
    key=None,
    axis=0,
    level=None,
    sort=True,
    observed=False,
    mutated=False,
    validate=True,
):
    group_axis = obj._get_axis(axis)

    if key is not None and axis == 1:  # Check if grouping along columns
        if isinstance(group_axis, Index):  # Ensure a single level index
            if key in obj.columns:
                key = key  # If key is in columns, use it
            else:
                raise KeyError(f"'{key}' not found in columns")
        else:
            raise ValueError("Grouping along columns requires single level index")

    grouper = BaseGrouper(
        group_axis,
        [Grouping(group_axis, key, obj=obj, name=key, sort=sort, observed=observed)],
        sort=sort,
        mutated=mutated
    )
    
    return grouper, [], obj
